card.name: Vae Victis
card.desc: After negotiating the Horoopolis Canals as common traders and unremarkable foreign travellers, the crew of the Vyłŭtåið Drakkar sails directly to Rome. They ditch their covering rags in the night and small groups of Kryėgř assault the ports of Misenum, Centum Cellae and Ostia under the cover of cloaking personal artefacts virtually unopposed. Their light-shooting weapons make short, melting work of the defensive Mechanici of the Republican Navy and the bloodseekers deal easily with any human unfortunate enough to meet the blades. The small land parties coalesce into one unit among the streets of Metropolitan Rome and are joined by the remaining troops as they head for the Collis Capitōlīnus guided by the Blööðølyktř. Dispersing into tiny one or two-man teams the one hundred strong military Vikings start moving from villa to villa the soldiers gathering political and economic hostages, and killing military leaders of the city's defensive and administrative organization, stealthily avoiding the main garrisons and concentrations of citizens. The units recover numerous artefacts from the most influential families in Rome, even more from the offices of Roman institutions and the most secret and valuable ones from forges and secret hideouts of the Purpura Officium itself. These include some of the most powerful and unstable artifacts in the world: the Armour of Achilles, the Veil of Isis, the Aegis, Morgelai, Caladbolg, the Rod of Asclepius, Ascalon, Xiuhcoatl, the Girdle of Hippolyta, the Kaustubha, the Lia Fáil, the Book of Thoth, the Orichalcum Samples and several flasks of Ambrosia, among many, many others. The Mechanic police and soldiers operating in the assaulted locations are powerless to stop the foreign high-tech assault, but some manage to trigger their emergency signals before they are dismantled. Soon the authorities, warned by the signals, can organize a strong response, surround the area, and initiate search and destroy missions with Manipulī of military Mechanici to sweep the streets and villas. As the moment of greater vulnerability for the Vikings dispersed throughout the city arrives and settles, with everyone surrounded, some under attack at that very instant and others under imminent threat, the signal is given from the Drakkar and it bellows forth from the Brísingamen around every Viking soldier's neck warning them to Extricate. The many not busy fighting gather their spoils and kill their hostages before smashing together their 雙錢 (shuāngqián) coins. The coins twinkle on contact and the users disappear with everything they were in wilful contact with. They reappear on the Drakkar a few minutes later, and after a few more minutes, the Yggřasiłŭŷfårið sounds his Gjallarhorn Olifant. The ship vanishes and Roman Republican authorities are left to deal with the first sack of Rome in millennia.

card.name: Lens
card.desc: - ## Lorenzo Bruni @lbruni

old.desc: - ## Mauro Bruno @maurobruno

card.desc:
After the discovery of Element 126, the Company is faced with a problem: no tool is strong enough to mine the element. While the board evaluates whether to risk investing the year’s almost entire research budget in a desperate attempt to find a way, a small group of three individuals offers the CEO an alternative: they will give them the means to get the Scrith, but will require over 30% of the raw material in return each month, delivered to a specific site in the region. 
The CEO accepts, and they give him a machine with a Scrith blade. The Company’s scientists, some of the finest minds and best paid minds of the world, quickly figure out how to reproduce the rest of the machine. The CEO orders his mercenaries to apprehend the three travellers, who do not oppose any resistance but remind him of their deal. After a month has passed, they ask the guards to relay a message to the CEO: they want their 30%. After a week has passed with no response, the three Lummentravellers appear in front of the board during a meeting and make quick work of them and of the guards, except one, whom is asked to relay the same message: deliver the 30% from now on. 
The material is quickly delivered to the indicated site by the new member of the board.

card.name: An interdimensional Drakkar appears out of the blue at 20.40374N 103.41914E. The crew - an Yggřasiłŭŷfårið (Yggdrasil navigator - basically, a historian specialized in mapping the connections between alternate timelines), a Blööðølyktř (Blood smeller, a person able to sense the leaking of a timeline's haecceity throughout the Bleed), a Kåfyř (Diver - a pilot capable of "diving" in the Bleed, guiding the vessel in the Bleed along the inferior parts of Yggdrasil, and re-emerging in the appropriate present), a Snåkyř (Communicator - a diplomat highly-trained at making first contact with the inhabitants of 20.40374N 103.41914E) and a division of 144 Kryėgř (soldiers) equally split between military engineers and assault troopers - set up a camp and immediately offer their services to the local King of Lan Xang, Arya Mandalani. With the support of the Viking militaries, Lan Xang tramples the adjacent kingdoms, breaking the quasi-equilibrium which has blessed the region for centuries. Every major and minor power reached by the news of the injection of advanced technology in the conflict tries to get their hands on the new weaponry, but the Vikings soon prove to be interested in just one kind of good: extra-contextus artifacts coming from the Unreachable Dimension whose Blood led them there in the first place.

card.name: Cheaper Underground
card.desc:
The rumour that a very large quantity of element 126 was found brings much concern in the Norman labs, and the concern escalates all the way up to the Throne of Grande-Bretagne: this could deal a significant blow to the nuclear research industry of the country. Hoping to exert pressure on the Indian government by virtue of a long-standing, albeit frail, friendship, Queen Louarn sends a discreet dispatch to the Indian diplomacy.

A week later, she has not received any answer, so she attempts a second message. Having received no further answer, she takes matters in her own hand and travels to the Indian capital with a handful of most trustworthy guards. As soon as she leaves the palace, three strangely dressed men appear out of thin air, wielding shiny firearms, and easily overcome the guards.

The Queen blinks and, when her eyes open, she finds herself in what appears to be a windowless laboratory, not dissimilar from the Norman ones, but full of brown-skinned scientists. Anjit Brahamanan Singh, a very old friend of the Norman Crown and now part of the top Indian diplomacy, greets her and shows her around the lab. As it turns out, element 126 is highly sought by some extracontextus travellers, who are prepared to exchange it for various riches and much valued scientific and technological knowledge.

Anjit and Louarn convene to keep the find secret. In exchange for stronger political, military, and commercial support form Grande-Bretagne to India, the Indians agree to share profits and knowledge resulting from the sale of 126.

In a blink of her eyes, the Queen is back on her throne.

card.name: Voices from the other side
card.desc:
A squad of miners, sent to investigate a huge and sudden blast in the deepest part of an arzebian bauxite mine, hastily runs back to the surface claming the whole place is cursed. During a further interrogation, the workers talk about strange, dark fissures on the tunnel walls. Scary noises and ominous, unintellegible words appear to be originating from them. The word spreads among other miners, and many of them start refusing to get back to work until the tunnels are sealed again.


## Lethal Weapon (_Dark_)

**Question**: _What is the reason behind the sealing of the tunnels?_
**Stage**: _Interrogation room, Praefectura in the city of Baku, the nearest to the mine_
**Characters**: _Sertorius Macro, Praefectus Vigilum of Baku; Əliyev, bauxite miner; Severus Vigiles, mechanical Servitor for the Vigiles of Baku_


**Notes**
_Defixiones: curse tablets used in the Roman world to communicate with the dead_
_Praefectus Vigilum: imperial official commanding the policemen of a city_

**Answer**:

_How can you even hope that I don’t throw your ass in the dirtiest cell here for this stupid story and for refusing to work, uh?!_

_But… defixiones, defixiones!_

_Aaaaahhhhh, magnus Iuppiter… pfff… I should have left this problem to Maximus Aurelius, the Praefectus Urbi… and NO_ 
He points his finger, trembling with frustration, at Severus, sitting beside him in and calmly throbbing its fingers rhythmically on its runic chestplate.
_Don’t you even dare to remind me of my stupid jurisdiction, I know the rules.
Okay, Əliyev, let’s calm down and talk through what happened last night and how you survived that blast. If you tell me everything you saw, I will ask the Augures to read the birds for you, they will do something for these… maledictions._

_…Yes, sir. Well, me and my mates and the turn leader, we were fixing the rope handrail for the new tunnel, see? That’s what we gotta do, when we push farther down the mine. The stone, it’s shinier down, but the road is rough, I’ve seen many folks falling over their instrument and breaking – themselves or the machines, what’s worst. 
Well, we were down, and I take the drill, see? And I start drilling the holes, but the stone was soft there, too soft. Not the usual one, I say to the turn leader, but he says go on! So we go on, right? But I want to see the soft stone, so I drill a hole up, a couple down, and I strip a piece of stone. And BAM! The rock was blue. Blue like water! I go near it, ‘cause I want to see it, maybe is sapphire, maybe I get to be rich, but no. Nonono._
_I see better and I see men-like figures. But they had no eyes, no face, no nothing. They looked like dead. And then… some shiny metal sting gets out of that blue rock. I take my drill, I try to hit it. Don’t know what I’m thinking. But I do it. The sting falls, I take it in my hands. I raise my eyes, and the dead start moving and hissing. I turn to the sting, I read some letters or symbols, and I freak out. It’s a defixiones from the dead! The dead cursed me!
The rock starts glowing lighter and the tunnel to tremble. I freak out, I run away. I black out and just run, run, run, while the tremble grows louder.
When I calm down, I look back. See nothing, but hear a blast. I get out. That’s it._

_So, Əliyev, you say that the blast was somehow created by this blue rip in the rock when you touched the sting, am I right? What about the metal sting?_

Əliyev nods and takes out of his pocket a small, cylindrical object with a hole inside supported by a rectangular base. It’s heavy, its polished surface and the smoothed angles suggest some kind of manufacturing. Sertorius closely looks at the base, where some kind of obscure symbols are carved. He passes the object to Severus. 
_Never seen a mine where metal goes in and doesn’t go out. What do you say?_

_It’s definitely made by somebody, or some machine._
Severus weighs the objects in its hands, inspecting it closely and beating it against the table of the room to hear its sound.

_Well, shit, this is too much. I’ll go smoke something and to call the Augures, be right back._

He lights up a cigarette and wonders: is that some kind of sick payback from the gods, who looked down at his past pride and deemed it so shameful to inflict him another punishment? 
He remembers 3 years before, the day he accepted the position as Praefectus Vigilum in Baku. The glory and the respect he dreamt he would have gained as Praefectus, the thrill of the action in the city. His laughs and smiles, crushing and crumbling against his wife’s skepticism, then doubt, then disagreement, then hostility. She always loved that domus near Massalia, but he was yearning for more.
Of course, he was wrong. About Baku, that dead city. About that job, so boring and pointless. And about Massalia, how he missed it and his domina… 

A dull noise surprises him, taking him back to reality; he rushes back to the room, where Severus is standing near a lying Əliyev, his Adam’s apple black and tumid.

_We… ehm, I suggest those tunnels should be sealed. This is serious, and it’s now a matter of CYPLEUM. Sertorius, I already contacted them, in these cases I’m duty-bound to, for the greater good. For your safety I think you should go away and forget. Even if it probably won’t make any difference, since I already told you too much. You see what I had to do to Əliyev._

_Whatever. I’m too old for this shit, anyway. Good bye._

He walks out of the room and the building. The streets are desert and the lights are dim. What a stupid city.

_…Yes, sir. Well, me and my mates and the turn leader, we were fixing the rope handrail for the new tunnel, see? That’s what we gotta do, when we push farther down the mine. The stone, it’s shinier down, but the road is rough, I’ve seen many folks falling over their instrument and breaking – themselves or the machines, what’s worst. 
Well, we were down, and I take the drill, see? And I start drilling the holes, but the stone was soft there, too soft. Not the usual one, I say to the turn leader, but he says go on! So we go on, right? But I want to see the soft stone, so I drill a hole up, a couple down, and I strip a piece of stone. And BAM! The rock was blue. Blue like water! I go near it, ‘cause I want to see it, maybe is sapphire, maybe I get to be rich, but no. Nonono._
_I see better and I see men-like figures. But they had no eyes, no face, no nothing. They looked like dead. And then… some shiny metal sting gets out of that blue rock. I take my drill, I try to hit it. Don’t know what I’m thinking. But I do it. The sting falls, I take it in my hands. I raise my eyes, and the dead start moving and hissing. I turn to the sting, I read some letters or symbols, and I freak out. It’s a defixiones from the dead! The dead cursed me!
The rock starts glowing lighter and the tunnel to tremble. I freak out, I run away. I black out and just run, run, run, while the tremble grows louder.
When I calm down, I look back. See nothing, but hear a blast. I get out. That’s it._

_So, Əliyev, you say that the blast was somehow created by this blue rip in the rock when you touched the sting, am I right? What about the metal sting?_

Əliyev nods and takes out of his pocket a small, cylindrical object with a hole inside supported by a rectangular base. It’s heavy, its polished surface and the smoothed angles suggest some kind of manufacturing. Sertorius closely looks at the base, where some kind of obscure symbols are carved. He passes the object to Severus. 
_Never seen a mine where metal goes in and doesn’t go out. What do you say?_

_It’s definitely made by somebody, or some machine._
Severus weighs the objects in its hands, inspecting it closely and beating it against the table of the room to hear its sound.

_Well, shit, this is too much. I’ll go smoke something and to call the Augures, be right back._

He lights up a cigarette and wonders: is that some kind of sick payback from the gods, who looked down at his past pride and deemed it so shameful to inflict him another punishment? 
He remembers 3 years before, the day he accepted the position as Praefectus Vigilum in Baku. The glory and the respect he dreamt he would have gained as Praefectus, the thrill of the action in the city. His laughs and smiles, crushing and crumbling against his wife’s skepticism, then doubt, then disagreement, then hostility. She always loved that domus near Massalia, but he was yearning for more.
Of course, he was wrong. About Baku, that dead city. About that job, so boring and pointless. And about Massalia, how he missed it and his domina… 

A dull noise surprises him, taking him back to reality; he rushes back to the room, where Severus is standing near a lying Əliyev, his Adam’s apple black and tumid.

_We… ehm, I suggest the mines should be closed. This is serious, and it’s now a matter of CYPLEUM. Sertorius, I already contacted them, in these cases I’m duty-bound to, for the greater good. For your safety I think you should go away and forget. Even if it probably won’t make any difference, since I already told you too much. You see what I had to do to Əliyev._

_Whatever. I’m too old for this shit, anyway. Good bye._

He walks out of the room and the building. The streets are desert and the lights are dim. What a stupid city.

His laughs and smiles, crushing and crumbling against his wife’s skepticism, then doubt, then disagreement, then hostility. She always loved that domus near Massalia, but he was yearning for more.
Of course, he was wrong. About Baku, that dead city. About that job, so boring and pointless. And about Massalia, how he missed it and his domina… 

A dull noise surprises him, taking him back to reality; he rushes back to the room, where Severus is standing near a lying Əliyev, his Adam’s apple black and tumid.

_We… ehm, I suggest the mines should be closed. This is serious, and it’s now a matter of CYPLEUM. Sertorius, I already contacted them, in these cases I’m duty-bound to, for the greater good. For your safety I think you should go away and forget. Even if it probably won’t make any difference, since I already told you too much. You see what I had to do to Əliyev._

_Whatever. I’m too old for this shit, anyway. Good bye._

He walks out of the room and the building. The streets are desert and the lights are dim. What a stupid city.

card.name: Voices from the other side
card.desc:
A squad of miners, sent to investigate a huge and sudden blast in the deepest part of an arzebian bauxite mine, hastily runs back to the surface claming the whole place is cursed. During a further interrogation, the workers talk about strange, dark fissures on the tunnel walls. Scary noises and ominous, unintellegible words appear to be originating from them. The word spreads among other miners, and many of them start refusing to get back to work until the tunnels are sealed again.


## Lethal Weapon (_Dark_)

**Question**: _What caused the blast in the mines? _
**Stage**: _Interrogation room, Praefectura in the city of Baku, the nearest to the mine_
**Characters**: _Sertorius Macro, Praefectus Vigilum of Back; Əliyev, bauxite miner; Severus Vigiles, mechanical Servitor for the Vigiles of Baku

**Answer**:

_How can you even hope that I don’t throw your ass in the dirtiest cell here for this stupid story and for refusing to work, uh?!_

_But… defixiones, defixiones!_

_Aaaaahhhhh, magnus Iuppiter… pfff… I should have left this problem to Maximus Aurelius, the Praefectus Urbi… and NO_ 
He points his finger, trembling with frustration, at Severus, sitting beside him in and calmly throbbing its fingers rhythmically on its runic chestplate.
_Don’t you even dare to remind me of my stupid jurisdiction, I know the rules.
Okay, Əliyev, let’s calm down and talk through what happened last night and how you survived that blast. If you tell me everything you saw, I will ask the Augures to read the birds for you, they will do something for these… maledictions._

_…Yes, sir. Well, me and my mates and the turn leader, we were fixing the rope handrail for the new tunnel, see? That’s what we gotta do, when we push farther down the mine. The stone, it’s shinier down, but the road is rough, I’ve seen many folks falling over their instrument and breaking – themselves or the machines, what’s worst. 
Well, we were down, and I take the drill, see? And I start drilling the holes, but the stone was soft there, too soft. Not the usual one, I say to the turn leader, but he says go on! So we go on, right? But I want to see the soft stone, so I drill a hole up, a couple down, and I strip a piece of stone. And BAM! The rock was blue. Blue like water! I go near it, ‘cause I want to see it, maybe is sapphire, maybe I get to be rich, but no. Nonono._
_I see better and I see men-like figures. But they had no eyes, no face, no nothing. They looked like dead. And then… some shiny metal sting gets out of that blue rock. I take my drill, I try to hit it. Don’t know what I’m thinking. But I do it. The sting falls, I take it in my hands. I raise my eyes, and the dead start moving and hissing. I turn to the sting, I read some letters or symbols, and I freak out. It’s a defixiones from the dead! The dead cursed me!
The rock starts glowing lighter and the tunnel to tremble. I freak out, I run away. I black out and just run, run, run, while the tremble grows louder.
When I calm down, I look back. See nothing, but hear a blast. I get out. That’s it._

_So, Əliyev, you say that the blast was somehow created by this blue rip in the rock when you touched the sting, am I right? What about the metal sting?_

Əliyev nods and takes out of his pocket a small, cylindrical object with a hole inside supported by a rectangular base. It’s heavy, its polished surface and the smoothed angles suggest some kind of manufacturing. Sertorius closely looks at the base, where some kind of obscure symbols are carved. He passes the object to Severus. 
_Never seen a mine where metal goes in and doesn’t go out. What do you say?_

_It’s definitely made by somebody, or some machine._
Severus weighs the objects in its hands, inspecting it closely and beating it against the table of the room to hear its sound.

_Well, shit, this is too much. I’ll go smoke something and to call the Augures, be right back._

He lights up a cigarette and wonders: is that some kind of sick payback from the gods, who looked down at his past pride and deemed it so shameful to inflict him another punishment? 
He remembers 3 years before, the day he accepted the position as Praefectus Vigilum in Baku. The glory and the respect he dreamt he would have gained as Praefectus, the thrill of the action in the city. His laughs and smiles, crushing and crumbling against his wife’s skepticism, then doubt, then disagreement, then hostility. She always loved that domus near Massalia, but he was yearning for more.
Of course, he was wrong. About Baku, that dead city. About that job, so boring and pointless. And about Massalia, how he missed it and his domina… 

A dull noise surprises him, taking him back to reality; he rushes back to the room, where Severus is standing near a lying Əliyev, his Adam’s apple black and tumid.

_We… ehm, I suggest the mines should be closed. This is serious, and it’s now a matter of CYPLEUM. Sertorius, I already contacted them, in these cases I’m duty-bound to, for the greater good. For your safety I think you should go away and forget. Even if it probably won’t make any difference, since I already told you too much. You see what I had to do to Əliyev._

_Whatever. I’m too old for this shit, anyway. Good bye._

He walks out of the room and the building. The streets are desert and the lights are dim. What a stupid city.

card.name: Palette
card.desc:
78# Exclusions

## Interstellar travel

It's not possible to travel to stars/star systems that are not the Sun (or strict equivalent in other timelines). 

## Same languages

Different dimensions do not share any kind of language

## Imperium Caput Mundi

The Roman Empire has not subjugated the totality of Earth, thus its direct political control is limited to a certain territory with a finite extension. In this world, consequently, there can be states that are vassals to the Empire, but also allied and/or enemy government systems.
This does not pose any constraint on the nature – i.e. the geography, the location and the populations – of these vassal states or government systems.

## Different Laws of Nature

Communicating universes have no differences within their laws of nature.
More specifically, the "abstract" structure of the laws is the same (e.g. same equations), but parameters may differ (e.g. a specific field/interaction might be stronger in one universe).
The aforementioned equality doesn't imply that those laws must be the same as ours, nor that they must be "mathematical" laws like ours.

## Time travel

Any form of time travel, including asynchronous communication between dimensions, does not exist in the story we are telling. For the purpose of  this story, time is assumed to be absolute and synchronous when travelling or communicating in any way across timeline. 

## Small World

As of both timelines' 2715AUC/1962 AD, no civilization knows/has ever known all major inhabited landmasses of their planets.

# Inclusions

## Unordinary magic mysticism

This does not imply that magic exists, nor, obviously, does it exclude its existence. There could be people who believe in magic, and that express their beliefs through mysticism. Some such people could even organise in cults, that can be open and public, or closed and secretive. The "magic" is not necessarily supernatural nor inexplicable. For example, higher-ups in a cult's hierarchy might know perfectly well that what the wider associates believe to be magic is in fact coming from very solid, plain, old, and even boring technology and science. The point is that any sufficiently advanced technology can be seen as magic, and people not-in-the-know can't necessarily be aware of this. On the other hand, they may very well, and yet partake in mysticism around said ordinary contraptions – e.g., the cult of the nut and bolt, that worships a literal combination of a nut and a bolt, and assigns arbitrary values to them, and create an aura of mysticism around such everyday objects.

## Powerful Artifacts

All Artifacts bestow powers on their owners and/or users. These powers are varied and often unpredictable but reproducible and ultimately controllable. Each artifact has one and only one power. These powers are active in the "Roman" dimension but don't manifest or exist in the "Fallen" one. Artifact often become known by the effects they cause.

## Criss-cross

Links between the two timelines occur several times in different points in the history of the "Roman" timeline. The corresponding points on the "States" timeline are not chronologically ordered.
Example: Roman-1 ---> States-30, Roman-20 ---> States-12, etc.

## Sentient non-humans

They (animals or otherwise) don't have to speak like humans, but they can have complex, structured societies, and communicate with humans in some way, verbal or non-verbal. This does not apply to the Fallen universe.

## Mechanical Servitors

The Empire has built its strength on the back of mechanical servitors. These forged metal constructs are animated and subjugated via alchemical runes etched on their steel and copper chestplates. The alchemical secrets by which these tireless slaves are constructed are kept flawlessly by the Factōrēs Hōrologiōrum, and they build every servitor at the Magna Fornāx deep in the center of Rome. These servitors are built to serve Roman citizens and Roman interests, they are duty-bound to fulfil every whim and carry out every command. The alchemical runes that give these slaves animation also give them sapience and also enforce the unbreakable compulsion to follow their masters' orders. The alchemical bonds occasionally break in accidents, most often resulting in the immediate de-animation of the constructs. In rare cases only the compulsion breaks, but the awakened servitors are swiftly recognized and decommissioned by a Factor at the nearest Fornāx Alimentōrum.

## Parallel Timelines

There are several alternate dimensions, not just two. 

## Caesaropapism

In all the Empire, religion is under direct control of the emperor. There are no religious authorities who are not directly related to political positions

card.name: The Adversaries
card.desc:
A few weeks after the blast a suspicious group of five masked people is seen hovering around a village near the mines, and a team of CYPLEUM agents is tasked to track and interrogate them.
The men are spotted in four different places in the span of a few minutes. All the spots are around the mine, at distances impossible to traverse in that short time. Not long after, a bright red light beacon shoots from the ground at a fifth spot, and screams are heard.
Agents find three of the men, hoods off, and what appear to be the glowing remains of the other two. One of the surviving men tightly holds a cuboid artifact with bright red glyphs on its sides. The glyphs burn the man's hands, but shock prevents him to let go of it. He reveals that his group comes from the African region of Kitara, and that they are following a path revealed by a book they found years earlier, which the stole from the hands of their tribe, who had banished them because of the book itself.
«It is too late. We should have drawn the pentangle before the breach; we tried nonetheless, but we have doomed your caves. He took two of our brothers. Fear for your brethren, now.»

card.name: Focus
card.desc:
- ### The Hybernian artefact
- ### Secret Organisations
- ### Regional Powers: the fanatic-pacifist Ινδικό βασίλειο (Indiko Basileio), a greek-ruled kingdom suzerain to the Parthians, committed to a thousand year old struggle to hegemonize the Indian Subcontinent; the Honorable Circles of आर्य मण्डलानि (Arya Mandalani), a loose league of rival city-states in South East Asia; the Southeastern African sovereign high-tech mining company of గోల్కొండ (Golconda); the matriarchal, Hebrew thalassocracy of 𐩪𐩨𐩱 (Saba), ruling over most of the Western Indian Ocean; the landlocked African Lakes kingdom of Kitara, whose rulers banished every form of writing in compliance with the precepts of their satanist creed; the Inuit Autonomous Tribes of ᕖᓄᓛᖖ ᑐᓕᔩᔾ (Viinulaang Tulijiij / Vinland and Thule) of the Arctic Circle and swaths of surrounding northern temperate coasts, plains and steppes; the Mislati Island People of the Sea Spikes, master sailors and builders of the Atlantic Ocean; and the Arawak Remnants on the coast of the southern continent, observers of the Eternal Fire.
- # Links to other dimensions

card.name: Universal Language
card.desc: The presumed universal translation artefact is finally found by an international expedition composed of scientists and adventures from all over the globe. The item is found in a small town of people sick with an unknown disease. It is a manuscript written on dead animal skin in a totally incomprehensible language, and from which Mat, an old man, reads stories he makes up. According to him, the manuscript appeared shortly after the disease started spreading, and once read in its entirety would reveal how to cure it. Once the Sacerdotes, who celebrate the plague, died, the rest of the population was looking for a leader and he, the only person able to read from the manuscript, was put in charge. In exchange for their promise to keep the book a secret from the Kitaran regime, he gives them time to carefully replicate the artefact and take the original, leaving him the copy. The expedition brings back the artefact, and the disease.

card.name: Deal
card.desc:
Rogelio Sidonius Petronico, known among the proles as Petrelio, Roman politician of the Lower Chamber, Speaker for the Republican Restorationist Party to the Governing Council of the Imperial Senate of the old Roman Empire, now Protector of the Committee of Restored Republican Safety of the Restored Roman Republic, meets with the Commercial Representatives of the Golconda Mining Company.

They reach a deal in a record breaking twenty minutes of talks: the Republic will provide Golconda with mining constructs and the people to direct and repair them, while Golconda will provide the Committee all it requires, in perpetuity.

card.name: Together with the Republican Refoundationist Front, the subversive and revolutionary branch of the Republican Restorationist Party of the Lower Chamber, the Quorum, and the support of a mid-level security bureaucrat named Iustus Osticatus, Rogelio Sidonius Petronico staged the Domus Assassination that killed Roman Emperor Tiberius Claudius Commodo, most of his Council members, all Roman Senators and their families assembled; Rogelio's coalition managed to place the blame on top members of the Purpura Officium and then use his role as Speaker to the Council to maneuver the Quorum and the few remaining Council members to appoint him Protector of a newly instituted "Committee of Restored Republican Safety". Before the Committee could establish firm control over the Mechanici and their manufacturing facilities several local governments wrangle free of Roman control. The Parthians and other long-standing Roman allies take this opportunity to distance themselves both militarily and economically from the new "Republic", while others push for more interlocking cooperation as is the case with the miners of గోల్కొండ (Golconda). Resentments of an all-but-ruling aristocratic caste of magic-wielding mechanical builders blamed for the attempted coup and savagely purged by a Committee trying to reestablish control, and an unruly populace spurred by an aggressive propaganda of blame and resentment eventually leads to a civil war between the Committee and the Imperial Provinces beyond Continental Europe, fought by a people that had grown accustomed to having mechanical constructs fight in their stead and had forgotten violent death. A war fought almost entirely through artefacts once the focus of feverish research by Roman Scientists, now commanded by the everyday Generals and Soldiers of both factions.

A war fought almost entirely through artefacts once the focus of feverish research by Roman Scientists, now commanded by the everyday Generals and Soldiers of both factions.

card.name: Together with the Republican Refoundationist Front, the subversive and revolutionary branch of the Republican Restorationist Party of the Lower Chamber, the Quorum, and the support of a mid-level security bureaucrat named Iustus Osticatus, Rogelio Sidonius Petronico staged the Domus Assassination that killed Roman Emperor Tiberius Claudius Commodo, most of his Council members, all Roman Senators and their families assembled; Rogelio's coalition managed to place the blame on top members of the Purpura Officium and then use his role as Speaker to the Council to maneuver the Quorum and the few remaining Council members to appoint him Protector of a newly instituted "Committee of Restored Republican Safety".Before the Committee could establish firm control over the Mechanici and their manufacturing facilities several local governments wrangle free of Roman control. The Parthians and other long-standing Roman allies take this opportunity to distance themselves both militarily and economically from the new "Republic", while others push for more interlocking cooperation as is the case with the miners of గోల్కొండ (Golconda). list.name: All roads lead to the end

card.name: Forever Lost
card.desc:
Hundreds of years have passed since the Great Eruption had showed them the way towards the Eternal Fire. The near-extinction of their people was a measly price to pay to finally reach the Flame in the South. The first generations that settled near the Flame were decimated by an unknown disease that an extraneous body had brought from a foreign world. Time passed, and the Fire granted them immunity to this and many other diseases. Afraid of losing their purity and the gift of the god, the Arawak Remnants pursued a radically isolationist policy. 
Now, the Plague burned through the rest of mankind, and they were the only ones to be left untouched. 

Nevertheless, the elders worried that the tribes were losing the favour of the god. As the same portents that preceded the Great Eruption were observed again, the Chieftain brought the entire tribe near the Fire Water, in whose abyss the Eternal Flame lied.

When the Parthian expedition arrived, they found extremely high Extradimensional Activity. While some of that was only the trace of past contacts with the World Beyond, most was coming from a specific place, a body of hot water. In the depth of the lake, they found, astonishingly, a non-artificially generated portal that had been continuously opened for almost a thousand years, and registered intense radiation coming from the portal. After alerting the Ministry of Knowledge, they proceeded with their mission: study the Arawaks and find a way to fight the Plague. 

They found several abandoned settlements, but nothing more. Investigating further, they concluded that the Arawaks had utterly dissolved in the Fire Water, and that the organic material found in the settlements and surrounding areas was completely insufficient to research a cure.

list.name: All roads lead to the end

card.name: Unexpected Spring
card.desc:
The discovery of the extracontextual distortion is acknowledged by the Mislati council of shamans, and the young Inuit is given permission to research it, in the hope that this may make it easier to obtain more powerful emberstone pebbles in the future. A research outpost is set up on one of the tiny icy islands far enough from people, and the young researchers quickly assembles a small group of bright-minded assistants. Work gets underway, and the initial findings point to a positive outcome for the Mislati.

During an experiment designed to attract emberstone pebbles to the surface without causing explosions and eruptions, a thin, brighter-than-daylight ray emanates from the site of the experiment upwards. Everyone within a 50 km radius is temporarily blinded, but otherwise unaffected. As the first people nearest to the research outpost regain their eyesight, and as soon as the ray's brightness is considerably diminished, they rush towards the seemingly unaffected research island, only to find that everything is fine, the everlasting ice cap has thawed, flora is flourishing despite the freezing temperature, and the researchers are unharmed, although visibly shaken and euphoric.

Later that day, when everyone is seeing again, the council of shamans meets the researchers to find out what happened. The young Inuit adventurer describes the experiment in great detail, and stops short of explaining why the emberstones pebbles are nowhere to be seen, and why the area surrounding the bright ray has suddenly become green and lively despite the freezing temperature.

The younger shamans propose that this has to be seen in light of Ye Ole Myths from the Westlands-over-Seas where a rain of fire and rocks destroyed vast stretches of barren wastelands, restoring their primordial fertility. The older shamans maintain that, during Ragnarok, fire and rocks fell from the sky, and destruction ensued, where here there are no rocks and fire to be seen, apart form the emberstone pebbles that are still safely underground, and the only visible effect is the ray of light, like a beacon to the skies, and a whole lot of inexplicable green. The researchers remind everyone that there is no hard evidence that Ragnarok happened like it is described in the Myths, and thus this could very well be another Ragnarok-type event. At any rate, the researchers ensure that they will continue their work on emberstone extraction, while investigating the new phenomena, which they decided to temporarily name ᒐᙵᓱᑌᓚ (Ganngasutaila).

old.name: Me so' rottorcazzo

card.name: Reports of very large rare earth veins buried in the నందా దేవి (Δραστηριότητα/Nanda Devi) area spawn a renewed interest for the Indian Region by the Sovereign Mining Company of గోల్కొండ. The Mining Company arrange a successful stealth airlift from their bases in సేరేండిబ్ (Serendib) and drop half a thousand operatives due south of నందా కోట్ (Το Φρούριο/Nanda Kot). Soon after that the men start test-drilling, they are faced with two most unexpected discoveries: the layers are extremely rich in స్క్రిత్ (Scrith), the hyper-strong and hyper-stable Element 126 (until then created only in Norman Labs, and in atomic quantities), and the area is full of ancient and extremely long artificial tunnels, delving into the mountains and containing evidence of centuries-long contacts between Ινδικό βασίλειο and the Subterranean Kingdom of శంభల, until then only fabled in legends. Hoping to find precious metals, well-trained men are sent there by the Company and start exploring the tunnels.

Soon after that the men start test-drilling, they are faced with two most unexpected discoveries: the layers are extremely rich in Scrith, the hyper-strong and hyper-stable Element 126 (until then created only in Norman Labs, and in atomic quantities), and the area is full of ancient and extremely long artificial tunnels, delving into the mountains and containing evidence of centuries-long contacts between Ινδικό βασίλειο and the Subterranean Kingdom of శంభల, until then only fabled in legends. Hoping to find precious metals, well-trained men are sent there by the Company and start exploring the tunnels.

Interstitial Alloy
card.desc:
The Sovereign mining company గోల్కొండ (Golconda) is famous for producing the finest aluminum of the world, coming from bauxite mines located near the labile and ever-changing 𐩪𐩨𐩱/గోల్కొండ (Saba/Golconda) border; their metal is so pure that even the shells of the Naves Terrae, pride and joy of the Roman army, are made of it.
When a small but powerful artifact is discovered in one of the newest mines, and its power later successfully integrated in the metal purification process line, the Board of National Directors approves the new strategic plan proposed by గోల్కొండCEO (Golconda CEO) Moshoeshoe Musaru: a series of joint secret explorations – in collaboration with the 𐩪𐩨𐩱 (Saba) Thalassocracy – through the newly-discovered Taproban, to find other artifacts and weaken the Roman influence on the region.
Despite being met with initial diffidence by the Saban Matriarchs, who blame గోల్కొండ (Golconda) for occupying mines and territories offered to them by יהוה(Yahweh), the promise of shared wealth, lands and artifacts succeed in forming a joint convoy, which quickly sets sail to the south-eastern coast of Taproban, where Golconda probes have detected a higher rock density in the crust.

card.name: In the landlocked African Lakes kingdom of Kitara an extracontextus book is found by a cabal of sectarists on an expedition to hunt a sacred elephant. The book does not contain words, only empty pages and a blank, leather-bound cover. Sectarists fight over the satanic interpretation of the artifact: is an empty book a benevolent sign from Satan, or is a book inherently a receptacle for the written word, and therefore an unholy artifact? The conflict exacerbates when, near a source of fire, words start to appear: the ones who defended the book are considered Enemies of Satan, and hunted from the Lakes.

ᐊᓗᐃᖅᑲᓇᖅ (Aluiqqanaq / Avalanche)
card.desc: The Mislati are a black-as-night-skinned population spanning the thousands upon thousands of rocky spike-islands, created over millennia by the most violent eruptions of the Edge of Fire, dotting the Atlantic ocean from the cold coastal settlements of southernmost ᕖᓄᓛᖖ, due south almost meeting the Edge of Fire and shadowing it all the way to the southern Atlantic continent where the Arawak Remnants live and toil at the edge of the eternal fire wall. An Inuit adventurer-researcher of the ᐊᓕᐊᓇᐃᑦ ᐊᖅᓴᕐᓃᑦ ᑐᓕᔩᔾ (Alianait Aqsarniit Tulijiij / Wonderful Northern Lights of Thule) University from the tribal near-endless steppes of the ᐊᑖᑕᑦᓯᐊᖅ ᓯᐲᕐ (Ataatatsiaq Sipiir / Grandfather Sibir), guest of a Mislati influential family in one of the largest rock-carved cities of the Atlantic, witnesses an eruption of the Edge of Fire at the local festivities for the Midsummer Fire Festival and is gifted an Emberstone Pebble (heated stones thrown from the depths of the ocean by the boiling activity of the Edge that can keep and transfer their heat slowly or explosively for months, even years in rare cases, that the Mislati people use domestically, professionally and trade occasionally) by the elder sage Shaman Wayuuna Kamusuchiwo’u, governor of the island of Goajira. He discovers upon the heated rock fresh trace elements of Extracontextual distortion, and proceeds to secretly test several more of the local utensils confirming preliminarily his doctoral hypothesis that the Edge of Fire is caused by the interaction of a massive artefact sunken deep within the ocean near the Mislati and cutting through the earth on the southern continent where the Arawak observers keep the fires at bay.

card.name: Focus
card.desc:
- ### The Hybernian artefact
- ### Secret Organisations
- # Regional Powers: the fanatic-pacifist Ινδικό βασίλειο (Indiko Basileio), a greek-ruled kingdom suzerain to the Parthians, committed to a thousand year old struggle to hegemonize the Indian Subcontinent; the Honorable Circles of आर्य मण्डलानि (Arya Mandalani), a loose league of rival city-states in South East Asia; the Southeastern African sovereign high-tech mining company of గోల్కొండ (Golconda); the matriarchal, Hebrew thalassocracy of 𐩪𐩨𐩱 (Saba), ruling over most of the Western Indian Ocean; the landlocked African Lakes kingdom of Kitara, whose rulers banished every form of writing in compliance with the precepts of their satanist creed; the Inuit Autonomous Tribes of ᕖᓄᓛᖖ ᑐᓕᔩᔾ (Viinulaang Tulijiij / Vinland and Thule) of the Arctic Circle and swaths of surrounding northern temperate coasts, plains and steppes; the Mislati Island People of the Sea Spikes, master sailors and builders of the Atlantic Ocean; and the Arawak Remnants on the coast of the southern continent, observers of the Eternal Fire.

card.name: Rumours concerning the existence of an artifact able to translate every language, located inside the isolated kingdom of Kitara, cause numerous expeditions to be organized by almost every state or empire in the world, as it is supposed to be the key to communicate with the people on the other side of the Portal. Adventurers try to access the territory by any mean necessary, and soon the presence of foreign people determines a heavy disruption in the political and social lifestyle of the african kingdom, expecially due to the introduction of new heresies and, most of all, written documents and papers.  Attempts to exploit the situation are made by the local government, however things go awry and eventually the kingdom is forced to face a failed coup d'état and the consequent (and drastic) countermeasures.

card.name: ᐊᓗᐃᖅᑲᓇᖅ
card.desc: The Mislati are a black-as-night-skinned population spanning the thousands upon thousands of rocky spike-islands, created over millenia by the most violent eruptions of the Edge of Fire, dotting the Atlantic ocean from the cold coastal settlements of southernmost ᕖᓄᓛᖖ, due south almost meeting the Edge of Fire and shadowing it all the way to the southern atlantic continent where the Arawak Remnants live and toil at the edge of the eternal fire wall. An Inuit adventurer-researcher of the ᐊᓕᐊᓇᐃᑦ ᐊᖅᓴᕐᓃᑦ ᑐᓕᔩᔾ (Alianait Aqsarniit Tulijiij / Wonderful Northern Lights of Thule) University from the tribal near-endless steppes of the ᐊᑖᑕᑦᓯᐊᖅ ᓯᐲᕐ (Ataatatsiaq Sipiir / Grandfather Sibir), guest of a Mislati influential family in one of the largest rock-carved cities of the Atlantic, witnesses an eruption of the Edge of Fire at the local festivities for the Midsummer Fire Festival and is gifted an Emberstone Pebble (heated stones thrown from the depths of the ocean by the boiling activity of the Edge that can keep and transfer their heat slowly or explosively for months, even years in rare cases, that the Mislati people use domestically, professionally and trade occasionally) by the elder sage Shaman Wayuuna Kamusuchiwo’u, governor of the island of Goajira. He discovers upon the heated rock fresh trace elements of Extracontextual distortion, and proceeds to secretly test several more of the local utensils confirming preliminarily his doctoral hypothesis that the Edge of Fire is caused by the interaction of a massive artifact sunken deep within the ocean near the Mislati and cutting through the earth on the southern continent where the Arawak observers keep the fires at bay.

card.name: As word of grand opportunities spreads through the tribes, several researchers, doctors, technicians and students of diverse and disparate disciplines secretly travel in troves from the Thulian universities of ᓯᐲᕐ (Sipiir / Sibir) and ᑐᕌᓐ (Turaan / Turan) to the spike islands of the Mislati to study and uncover the mysteries of the Sunken Artifact. Over just a few hectic years the secret, undiscovered collaboration between the tribal lords of cold-as-glaciers Vinland and the elder sages of the hot-as-lava Mislati leads to the uncovering of the nature of the Edge of Fire, forging a beneficial and lasting bond between the two people and furthering an already profound but ever deepening understanding among the Thulian academics of the nature and potential of the artifacts flooding ever increasingly into the world.
Focus
card.desc:
- ### The Hybernian artefact
- ### Secret Organisations
- # Regional Powers: the fanatic-pacifist Ινδικό βασίλειο (Indiko Basileio), a greek-ruled kingdom suzerain to the Parthians, committed to a thousand year old struggle to hegemonize the Indian Subcontinent; the Honorable Circles of आर्य मण्डलानि (Arya Mandalani), a loose league of rival city-states in South East Asia; the Southeastern African sovereign high-tech mining company of గోల్కొండ (Golconda); the matriarchal, Hebrew thalassocracy of 𐩪𐩨𐩱 (Saba), ruling over most of the Western Indian Ocean; the landlocked African Lakes kingdom of Kitara, whose rulers banished every form of writing in compliance with the precepts of their satanist creed; the Inuit Autonomous Tribes of ᕖᓄᓛᖖ ᑐᓕᔩᔾ (Viinulaang Tulijiij / Vinland and Thule) of the Arctic Circle and swaths of surrounding northern temperate coasts, plains and steppes; the Mislati Island People of the Sea Spikes, master sailors and builders of the Atlantic Ocean; and the Arawak Remnants on the coast of the southern continent, obvservers of the Eternal Fire.

card.name: Objects
card.desc:
Magister Sabinus looked at the Object, his face showing no emotion. The other associates knew he was admiring their latest work with pride and anguish. Their skill was no mystery. All of them had a quasi-superhuman talent for craftsmanship, an ability to think something vividly and use the world’s tools to make it concrete. The latest Artefact was their new best work, just as the one before it, and the one before that, and the one before that. After a thorough examination, Sabinus deemed the Object up to their standards, but he also maintained that while it was good enough for the present, it might not be enough to confound the future. He reminded them that Perception was just technology and while they only needed the illusion to last until reality was utterly weakened and the laws of physics too malleable to make a meaningful distinction between their Objects and the Extracontextus Artefacts, that time could be long to come and, in the meanwhile, technological advance could uncover the intra-dimensional nature of their craft. Furthermore, since no one could know the truth behind their Artefacts in the final days, every failure burdened more and more associates with the knowledge that they were dooming the next generation to commit suicide in their place, instead of letting them live in a world of awe and wonder. 
The Ordo Mundorum, whose mission is to craft a new reality in which mundanity is but a fraught and perfect identity of vision and matter is achieved, release the new True Artefact in to the world, in a place known to no one but Magister Sabinus himself, while the ones commissioned by their Roman masters were placed on Taproban, to be used as tools in a petty war.

card.name: URGAMADONNA
card.desc:
Commander Aestus is summoned to a remote location by a very inconspicuous messenger. After two days of travel in a blind carriage, he is let outside and into a small, very white, and minimally decorated hall. As soon as all personnel has left the hall, no less than the Queen appears.

She says that rumours have come to her attention regarding several priceless artefacts, and she wants to obtain them. She does not state the reason for this, but suggests that Aestus puts together a very covert mission to investigate such rumours.

Commander Aestus is led outside the hall and into the carriage again, carrying a bright white finger ring in his pocket. Upon his return to Rome, the army asks him to travel to Taproban and investigate rumours of several extra-contextus artefacts. He is told to acquire them wherever possible because reliable intelligence has it that a previously unknown third party is very interested in them for unknown, but presumably nefarious, reasons.

old.name: The fall of CYPLEUM?

card.name: The fall of CYPLEUM?
card.desc:
Commander Aestus of CYPLEUM receives the report regarding the events surrounding the APOLLO patch operation. It is not clear to him whether to consider the operation a success or a failure, and decides to investigate what this "World" is.

An elite team of top agents-scientists are given the highest clearance to work on the Nectant, and manage to stabilise the portal for more than a few instants. They are however unsure of how to reliably re-open it in the same target destination, therefore making the travel back nearly impossible. They think they have detected a pattern, but are still working on it when Aestus and the Scunkii demand to be let through the portal.

Despite resisting, the scientists open the portal, and the eager agents travel through, carrying minimum survival equipment. When the portal closes, the scientists resume their work on aiming the portal, knowing that, otherwise, 
Commander Aestus and the top squad of CYPLEUM are forever lost on an alien world.

old.name: HAHAHAHAHA

card.name: Of branches and twigs
card.desc:
An alarming, hand-written note is found next to the dead body of Theron of Syracuse.

The senior and well-respected researcher working on the Hybernian Artefact says he may have discovered that the interdimensional navigation technique can not only be used to navigate through parallel dimensions, but also to branch from the current one into an almost identical one from the starting point. The only caveat would be that the navigators die in their current branch, and carry on into the new one.

Theron writes that he believes that the branches would be free of the adverse effects of interdimensional travel in their respective trunks – such as the emergence of Mors Parabolica and other similar abnormalities – thus providing a chance at a fresh start from everyone. He writes that he has no way of proving this but by trying this himself.

Theron is never heard of again, but the promise of a fresh start, albeit faint, leads a number of his colleagues to organise an escape plan from a terrible past plagued by bad choices.

card.name: As the discovery of Taproban - a new, huge continent graced at least partly by a temperate night-day cycle - goes public in Rome and Roman settlers swarm its western coast, a secret mission is organised to explore the outback and possibly reach the Eastern coast. After a long preparation, a mixed group of Roman spec-ops and Indian caravan travellers leave in a partially mechanised caravan of Naves Terrae and encounter a paradise of fertile land and a big inner sea. There, they make contact with a quasi-latin-speaking, Christian population of exiles of a never-heard-before "Empire of the Sun" (Sol-de Imperium), whose ardently pagan inhabitants originate from a mysterious archipelago close to Qin and reportedly conquered vast stretches of the Eastern Ocean before meeting and subjugating a population of Sun-worshippers prospering in the life-threatening lands of the perpetual sun. The convoy starts retracing its route to the Western Coast, but one night the Indian travellers - who are in fact adepts of the murderous sept of Thugs - kill all the Romans except for the Mechanicus and hijack the earthships to the North, where they meet their Parthian masters.

Poof!
card.desc:
A secret mission consisting of three highly-trained, specialised roman soldiers in charge of recovering the newly discovered artifact on Luna has been planned and funded, except for a crucial detail: nobody knows how to enter the Lijang outpost, where pieces of information about the artifact wereabouts are supposed to be hold. The entire Qinian sector of the moon is strictly under surveillance, and no accounts of people managing to break in a Qin lunar base exist.
The squad members are face to face, inside a filthy warehouse in Siracusae, with an exponent of the "Lone Travelers", who are renowned for their ability to provide access to any place anywhere in the world, given the required fee is paid.
Negotiations go on for a while, including a payment of a huge quantity of pure gold and the permission to build a Lone Travelers office on the roman portion of Lunar soil.
At the end of the meeting, the three agents are guaranteed to "be able to instantly appear inside the Lijang facility". Which happens immediately after.


## As Still as Mountains?

**Question**:  Where lie the real and deepest motivation and benefit – apart from the gold and the building permission – for the “Lone Travelers” to help the Roman soldiers?

**Stage**: Apsis of the Prior Traveler, Lone Travelers headquarters, somewhere west of Constantinopolis

**Characters**: _Lao Yi-Yi_, Grand Master Traveler and head of the Lone Travelers society. _Sun Yi-Yi_, Second Traveler and Second Warden. _Phidias ‘The Pale’ Chen-Tao_, Secretary of the Lone Travelers. _Weng Tao-Fu_, exponent of the Lone Travelers in the negotiations with the Roman soldiers.

**Answer**:

**Tone**:

card.name: Rise of CYPLEUM
card.desc:
Several artifacts have been found which basically consist of clusters of scrap metal. These pieces emit a low gaussian field but do not seem to have the capabilities of more powerful artifacts.

Druids and scientists decide to perform an experiment by forging weapons with this metal. A sword and a shield are slipped in a Legion's equipment to test their capabilities. Centurion Servius Aquilina ends up with the shield, and Soldier Antonius Regulus with the sword.
During a skirmish against a Norman division, Antonius is killed and his sword taken by an enemy soldier. Fatefully, this soldier finds himself fighting Centurion Aquilinas.

When the sword and the shield clash against each other, both the battalions are quickly annihilated. The incident is covered up and a decision is made: a stricter oversight of Extracontextus Artifacts is necessary. A secret agency consisting of the finest scientists, druids and black ops operatives is made, and it is named CYPLEUM after Centurion Aquilina's fateful shield.

card.name: A Secret Power
card.desc:
Multiple artefact-modified hot air baloon forays to the Roman-mined Mun (Moon, the inner satellite) have provided Qin atmosphericists with the inkling that the Mantle (the chaotic medium through which Mun travels in its close orbit around Terra) might reach all the way to the end of the atmosphere, to the edge of empty space itself. Many more artefact-enhanced flights tasked to breach this edge have resulted in numerous senseless deaths and an ingrained conviction that this ultimate frontier might be impossible to reach and explore.

After stealing several thousand tons of steel, aluminium and related composites from the Roman heavy-industry region of Arzebia Inferior, through several Parthian false-flag attacks, scattering useless artefacts to distract and misdirect local investigations, the Qin Ministry of Shadows is instructed by Qin Shi Zheng Huang the Visionary, King of Qin and Wu, to calculate the requirements for the third phase of operation 滲透面紗 (Pierce the Veil). 

Qin Shi Zheng Huang travels to the Darkened Citadel under the Mantle. The magnificent phalanx of thirty million Qin soldiers, purposefully arrayed on the open grounds of the secret facility like a giant carpet made of millions upon millions of flag-wielding terra-cotta warriors, fits inside a square six kilometers on each side. At the first signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang, the phalanx shifts into complicated and detailed circuit patterns that gradually fill the entire formation to form the "Mother Board". Groups of two or three soldiers spread into AND, OR, XOR, NAND, NOR, XNOR and NOT logical units througout. The five best divisions under the command of Minister Lü Buwei of the Shadows form the core calculating component, the "Central Processing Unit", and several address, register and highly regular stack memory sub-formations. A passage for the cavalry division of the "System Bus" runs through the entire formation. Further to the south, on a small cliff overlooking the fields, stands the bottleneck of the entire endeavour, the "Hard Drive" building housing three million educated soldiers tasked with writing down results, intermediate calculations and recording everything that happens inside the main formation; a "Display" division spreads from the building and updates at periodic intervals to show final results and status updates to the Command Observers. After a second signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang the elements of the logical components begin running self-contained integrity tests, the "Input" soldiers wave their flags and wait for the correct response from their "Output" counterparts; malfunctioning or distracted units are replaced swiftly and ruthlessly with soldiers from the reserve. Tens of millions of flags wave across the umbrage plains, sparkling faintly under the weak sun-light filtering from the far horizon. A "Progress Bar" of numerous green flags gradually advances through the "Display" division indicating the percentage of completed integrity tests. After the completion of the tests, the "System Bus" division is ordered to instruct the entire formation to load the "Qin 1.1" operating set of system-wide instructions. The cavalry moves swiftly though the components and soon turns into a turbulent river feeding into numerous thin tributaries infiltrating all the modular subformation of the "Computer Army". The ripple of black and white flags coalesces into surging waves racing through the entirety of the "Mother Board". At this point a third and final signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang, puts the calculations in motion. The master computing module, the differential calculus module, the finite element analysis module, the spectral method module, the initial memory storage module, and all other operating sub-formations begin pulsing with activity. Thirty million sets of hands sparkle, flash, wave and carry out precise choreographies, as the "Display" division struggles to keep up with the information flow, waving indicators of every color and lifting letter boards.

At the end of its operational cycle, the "Hard Drive" division "saves" the final results copying them to several hundred scrolls. Travel vectors, stress calculations, manufacturing parameters, and thousands of other precise instructions; everything the King requires to direct Qin builders, engineers and manufacturers. After returning to his palace in the Qin Sea Capital of Shencheng, he gives orders to begin phase four of operation 滲透面紗, that will push the first man-made object past the thick edge of the atmosphere, send the first human into empty space, put the first Qin fully above the Mantle and establish the first settlements on Terra's second satellite visible faintly from the surface of Mun, Luna.

Qin Shi Zheng Huang travels to the Darkened Citadel under the Mantle. The magnificent phalanx of thirty million Qin soldiers, purposefully arrayed on the open grounds of the secret facility like a giant carpet made of millions upon millions of flag-wielding terra-cotta warriors, fits inside a square six kilometers on each side. At the first signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang, the phalanx shifts into complicated and detailed circuit patterns that gradually fill the entire formation to form the "Mother Board". Groups of two or three soldiers spread into AND, OR, XOR, NAND, NOR, XNOR and NOT logical units througout. The five best divisions under the command of Minister Lü Buwei of the Shadows form the core calculating component, the "Central Processing Unit", and several address, register and highly regular stack memory sub-formations. A passage for the cavalry division of the "System Bus" runs through the entire formation. Further to the south, on a small cliff overlooking the fields, stands the bottleneck of the entire endeavour, the "Hard Drive" building housing three million educated soldiers tasked with writing down results, intermediate calculations and recording everything that happens inside the main formation; a "Display" division spreads from the building and updates at periodic intervals to show final results and status updates to the Command Observers. After a second signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang the elements of the logical components begin running self-contained integrity tests, the "Input" soldiers wave their flags and wait for the correct response from their "Output" counterparts; malfunctioning or distracted units are replaced swiftly and ruthlessly with soldiers from the reserve. Tens of millions of flags wave across the umbrage plains, sparkling faintly under the weak sun-light filtering from the far horizon. A "Progress Bar" of numerous green flags gradually advances through the "Display" division indicating the percentage of completed integrity tests. After the completion of the tests, the "System Bus" division is ordered to instruct the entire formation to load the "Qin 1.1" operating set of system-wide instructions. The cavalry moves swiftly though the components and soon turns into a turbulent river feeding into numerous thin tributaries infiltrating all the modular subformation of the "Computer Army". The ripple of black and white flags coalesces into surging waves racing through the entirety of the "Mother Board". At this point a third and final signal from Qin Shi Zheng Huang, puts the calculations in motion. The master computing module, the differential calculus module, the finite element analysis module, the spectral method module, the initial memory storage module, and all other operating sub-formations begin pulsing with activity. Thirty million sets of hands sparkle, flash, wave and carry out precise choreographies, as the "Display" division struggles to keep up with the information flow, waving indicators of every color and lifting letter boards.

At the end of its operational cycle, the "Hard Drive" division "saves" the final results copying them to several hundred scrolls. Travel vectors, stress calculations, manufacturing parameters, and thousands of other precise instructions; everything the King requires to direct Qin builders, engineers and manufacturers. After returning to his palace in the Qin Sea Capital of Shencheng, he gives orders to begin phase four of operation 滲透面紗, that will push the first man-made object past the thick edge of the atmosphere, send the first human into space, put the first Qin fully above the Mantle and establish the first settlements on Terra's second satellite visible faintly from the surface of Mun, Luna.

card.name: A Secret Power
card.desc:
Multiple artefact-modified hot air baloon forays to the Roman-mined Mun (Moon, the inner satellite) have provided Qin atmosphericists with the inkling that the Mantle (the chaotic medium through which Mun travels in its close orbit around Terra) might reach all the way to the end of the atmosphere, to the edge of empty space itself. Many more artefact-enhanced flights tasked to breach this edge have resulted in numerous senseless deaths and an ingrained conviction that this ultimate frontier might be impossible to reach and explore.

After stealing several thousand tons of steel, aluminium and related composites from the Roman heavy-industry region of Arzebia Inferior, through several Parthian false-flag attacks, scattering useless artefacts to distract and misdirect local investigations, the Qin Ministry of Shadows is instructed by Qin Shi Zheng Huang the Visionary, King of Qin and Wu, to calculate the requirements for the third phase of operation 滲透面紗 (Pierce the Veil).

card.name: Truth
card.desc:
The first Parthian expedition to explore Taproban found a series of deeply unusual objects of seemingly unfathomable function and absurd craftsmanship. 
After further inquiry, a meeting was called to establish the final truth on these objects. The Kaveh Secretary of Materials, the Esfandyiar Secretary of Religion, and the Suren Ministry of External Affairs and Esptionage all agreed, based on their investigation, that the objects could be traced back to the Ordo Mundorum, a secret cult based in the Eastern Roman Empire and dedicated to destabilising reality by introducing extraneous objects. After a short debate everyone else, including the influential Mihran Ministry of War, agreed to the conclusion and the Definitive Truth on the Taprobanean Objects was proclaimed by the Zoroaster Ministry of Truth and Flame. Evidence of a Roman investigation into the objects were consequently attributed to the Empire’s ongoing war on secret religions, and given limited attention. 
Thanks to the Empire’s masterful craftsmen, spies, and diplomats, the Roman plan had succeeded.
