## Palette
### M1P2

card.name: Palette
card.desc:
# Exclusions

## Interstellar travel

It's not possible to travel to stars/star systems that are not the Sun (or strict equivalent in other timelines). 

## Same languages

Different dimensions do not share any kind of language

## Imperium Caput Mundi

The Roman Empire has not subjugated the totality of Earth, thus its direct political control is limited to a certain territory with a finite extension. In this world, consequently, there can be states that are vassals to the Empire, but also allied and/or enemy government systems.
This does not pose any constraint on the nature – i.e. the geography, the location and the populations – of these vassal states or government systems.

## Different Laws of Nature

Communicating universes have no differences within their laws of nature.
More specifically, the "abstract" structure of the laws is the same (e.g. same equations), but parameters may differ (e.g. a specific field/interaction might be stronger in one universe).
The aforementioned equality doesn't imply that those laws must be the same as ours, nor that they must be "mathematical" laws like ours.

## Time travel

Any form of time travel, including asynchronous communication between dimensions, does not exist in the story we are telling. For the purpose of  this story, time is assumed to be absolute and synchronous when travelling or communicating in any way across timeline. 

## Small World

As of both timelines' 2715AUC/1962 AD, no civilization knows/has ever known all major inhabited landmasses of their planets.

# Inclusions

## Unordinary magic mysticism

This does not imply that magic exists, nor, obviously, does it exclude its existence. There could be people who believe in magic, and that express their beliefs through mysticism. Some such people could even organise in cults, that can be open and public, or closed and secretive. The "magic" is not necessarily supernatural nor inexplicable. For example, higher-ups in a cult's hierarchy might know perfectly well that what the wider associates believe to be magic is in fact coming from very solid, plain, old, and even boring technology and science. The point is that any sufficiently advanced technology can be seen as magic, and people not-in-the-know can't necessarily be aware of this. On the other hand, they may very well, and yet partake in mysticism around said ordinary contraptions – e.g., the cult of the nut and bolt, that worships a literal combination of a nut and a bolt, and assigns arbitrary values to them, and create an aura of mysticism around such everyday objects.

## Powerful Artifacts

All Artifacts bestow powers on their owners and/or users. These powers are varied and often unpredictable but reproducible and ultimately controllable. Each artifact has one and only one power. These powers are active in the "Roman" dimension but don't manifest or exist in the "Fallen" one. Artifact often become known by the effects they cause.

## Criss-cross

Links between the two timelines occur several times in different points in the history of the "Roman" timeline. The corresponding points on the "States" timeline are not chronologically ordered.
Example: Roman-1 ---> States-30, Roman-20 ---> States-12, etc.

## Sentient non-humans

They (animals or otherwise) don't have to speak like humans, but they can have complex, structured societies, and communicate with humans in some way, verbal or non-verbal. This does not apply to the Fallen universe.

## Mechanical Servitors

The Empire has built its strength on the back of mechanical servitors. These forged metal constructs are animated and subjugated via alchemical runes etched on their steel and copper chestplates. The alchemical secrets by which these tireless slaves are constructed are kept flawlessly by the Factōrēs Hōrologiōrum, and they build every servitor at the Magna Fornāx deep in the center of Rome. These servitors are built to serve Roman citizens and Roman interests, they are duty-bound to fulfil every whim and carry out every command. The alchemical runes that give these slaves animation also give them sapience and also enforce the unbreakable compulsion to follow their masters' orders. The alchemical bonds occasionally break in accidents, most often resulting in the immediate de-animation of the constructs. In rare cases only the compulsion breaks, but the awakened servitors are swiftly recognized and decommissioned by a Factor at the nearest Fornāx Alimentōrum.

## Parallel Timelines

There are several alternate dimensions, not just two. 

## Caesaropapism

In all the Empire, religion is under direct control of the emperor. There are no religious authorities who are not directly related to political positions

list.name: All roads lead to the end

card.name: As the bubonic plague scourges the Mundus Cognitus, an intensification of the phenomenon of "Dissolutio Artificiorum" convinces the remaining insurgents that the end of their struggle is near. Yussuf and Sakura are among the many who decide to take their fortune and set sail to the West, but they disappear during the travel together with the Prima Machina. There are a few last attemps at bringing a cure from the other dimension using the remaining artifacts, but they all eventually fail.

old.name: The Winner
M1C1 ~ Overthrow Allowance

card.name: House Rules
card.desc:
- ## *No dates in periods and events, and no specific time-periods inter-events.*

E.g: 5232 A.D, 1932, "A week after the...", "Exactly one year before the...", "Two days had passed when suddenly..."


- ## *At the end of each Macro Cycle all players will vote on the matter of "story conclusion", by either voting for continuation or conclusion.*

If conclusion is decided, a final turn without focus is played to give everyone a chance to flesh out last minute details they may be interested in. Otherwise another full Macro Cycle is played normally.


- ## *Focuses can be extended with a short description detailing their nature and providing clarification on intent.*

The responsibility of clarity and restriction of this description rests on the turn's Lens, but so does ultimate interpretation on any dispute. The Lens has complete power over his Focus' intent.


# Additional Definitions


## Periods

Periods are lists of events, together with a description summarizing "what happens" and a label specifying the tone.
Let's emphasize the role of this "what happens" component, by stating that:

- Summaries shall outline clearly what are the changes in the situation that constitute the scope of the period.

- Events in the period shall develop the "causal chains" which explain the aforementioned changes and make the situation progress from point A (the virtual beginning of the period) to point B (the virtual end of the period). Obviously, the events shall also fall in the time delimitations set by the summary.

Since events which are unrelated to the causal chains of a period can't be legitimately part of that period, they should be part of other periods (with their own causal chains).


## Events

Events are the backbone of the story, they delineate a path inside the world and put our attention on parts of the history that we or others may find interesting. They should not be the narrative. The narrative exists inside our minds.

Answering these questions when creating an event will ensure proper event design:


* ##### Does it clearly define the **WHO**, the **WHERE** and the **WHAT**?
If the answer is _no_ to at least two of these, the event should be revised.

* ##### Does the event have a definite and clear outcome?
If it doesn't it probably isn't an event.

* ##### Is it the clearest and most informative form of the event? Can it be written with fewer details?
If it can be written with fewer details, do so.
Try to convey all important information but leave the fluff out.
Keep it simple, direct and as short as you need it to be.

* ##### Does it support expansion and exploration with at least one scene?
If it doesn't it probably isn't a very good event.


## Scenes

Scenes are used to figure out motivations, explore related outcomes, detail character interaction and they can also help flesh out the details of the events, giving them body and imprinting upon them a specific narrative.

When writing a dictated scene freedom is paramount. You are constrained by what has been written before, and by the requirement to answer the question, but the player can proceed at his discretion in the pursuit of that goal.

Where interpreting a played scene collaboration is paramount, but don't get stomped on. Figure out a direction and psychology for your character and draw a mental general picture you would like the scene to reflect, and go from there. If you want to steer things in a particular direction, take such opportunities when they present themselves.

Scenes are where things that have happened shine in the spotlight.


### *Subsystem for Played Scenes*

A new subsystem is in place, designed to structure the proposal of Played Scenes. 

The first part of the system is a new Checklist Card in Synopsis & Instruction that serves as a Played Scenes counter. Whenever a player add a Played Scene he also adds a checklist element to this counter. When the counter reaches THREE (3) yet unplayed Played Scenes, normal game flow is suspended at the end of the current TURN (the player currently playing finishes his turn, he is the one that added the last played scene so this is straightforward).

A Scene Day is organized as early as possible, in the next few weeks most likely, with the usual selection process. Whoever can't make it will have to regretfully pass on the played scene.

Each scene is played normally but a time constraint is applied to it. Each scene must last at most ALLOTTED TIME / NUMBER OF SCENES or, more easily, ONE HOUR.

All currently unplayed Played Scenes *MUST* be played in the session.

Once all unplayed Played Scenes are played normal game flow is resumed.


## Legacies

A new mechanic is added to each turn, beside the Lens, the Focus and the normal Legacy: the Legacy Overthrow Allowance. This mechanic allows for a certain number of Focus Overthrows per turn. The number of Overthrows can be calculated with ROUND ( PLAYERS / 3 ).

An Overthrow allows a player that is making use of it to disregard the current Focus and instead use a Legacy as if it was the Focus.

As Legacy Overthrow Allowances are limited per turn they operate on a first-come first-serve basis. Once the current turn allowances are exhausted, they are re-instituted at the beginning of the next turn.

The Lens is barred from using Allowances during his Lens Turn.

If by the end of a turn one of more allowances are still available, ONE allowance is added to the subsequent turn's pool of available Overthrows.

Under Overthrow you are restricted to Events and Dictated Scenes, just as you would be when playing a standard Legacy.

An Event or Scene played under Overthrow is labelled as a Legacy, and it must be properly marked with the Legacy used just as a normal Legacy would be.

card.name: The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has survived. It is now the year 2751AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).
A complicated friendship between a time traveller and an immortal.

The members of the first international expedition to Mars discover an old Soviet flag placed down decades ago. The Soviets had won the space race long before but decided to bury their success and the horrifying truths it revealed.

A contingent of mackerels is forced to leave its original river after a human-caused catastrophe destroys it, and has to venture in the countryside in order to establish a new colony and live a new life, amidst new friend and many new foes.
The complicated relationship between a time traveller and his immortal mother-in-law.

A contingent of rabbits is forced to leave its original warren after a catastrophe destroys it, and has to venture in the countryside in order to establish a new warren and live a new life, amidst new friend and many new foes.

The Roman Empire has fought barbarians and traitors everywhere it has expanded, but it has always overcome, endured and eventually thrived. It is now the year 2754AUC (Ab Urbe Condita) and the Twin Arches of Nova Roma and the surrounding districts have just been destroyed by a Pyrobolus Atomicus linked to Irochesi and Cerochesi freedom fighters.
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has conquered the Galaxy. It is now the year 2000 AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has conquered the Galaxy. It is now the year 2000 AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has conquered the Galaxy. It is now the year 2000 AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has conquered the Galaxy. It is now the year 2000 AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).

The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought a contingent of rabbits; then relocated to Mars, where an old Soviet Rabbit flag placed down decades ago is discovered, triggering the Divine Apocalypse between the Roman Gods and two distinct, rival groups of rabbit deities: Immortals and Time Travellers. It is now year 90210 RC (Rodents' Carrots).
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but a small village of indomitable Gauls still holds out against the invaders. It is now the year 2751 after the death of Obelix the Great.

The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and perished, but the Sacred Order of the Vestals of the Holy Fire has survived, shrouded in secrecy. It is now the year 27510AUC (Ab Urbe Condita): time for the Cult to come out in the open.

A contingent of stone age Siberians living east of the Yenisei River are forced to leave their original warren after a climate change-caused catastrophe destroys it, and have to venture in the Bering Land Bridge in order to establish a new warren and live a new life, amidst new friends and many new foes.

The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has survived. It is now the year 2715AUC (Ab Urbe Condita), and the Empire's Intelligence is struggling to cope with the diffusion among insurgent groups of artifacts of unknown source, hinting at the existence of a parallel timeline where the Empire has fallen and Europe is fragmented into many national states.
A complicated friendship between a time traveller and an immortal unfolds from a human sacrifice at an Olmec village to the edge of the novo-vacuum where existence ends.
As the Nuclear Apocalypse scourges the Earth's surface, a bunch of survivors find refuge in the underground. Where they eventually meet the Others.
Current Phase

Final Preference. One winner. Condorcetto.

Assign yourselves to exactly 2 (*TWO*) Big Picture Proposals (one primary selection and one backup selection). the chosen big pictures will go to the Final Preference and one will be selected.

The members of the first international expedition to Mars discover an old Byzantine flag placed down centuries ago. In the attempt of saving their dinasty from the advance of the Ottomans, the last Basileis had conceived a centuries-long secret plan to move to the Red Planet by the XVII century. Despite the technological superiority, the expedition faces the same, horrific threats that halted the Byzantine colonization, and finds out that they have much to learn from their forerunners' errors&discoveries.

card.name: The Emeritus Doctor Louisiana Jones, in the year 3692 A.I., reveals that the entrance to the long forgotten city of Atlantis is in Crete. (an epistular story)

card.name: Very, very few superpowered individuals exist on Earth, hunted by powerful government agencies. Most of them are unaware of their own superpowers until a rogue government agent intentionally starts a chain of events that will bring many of them together to fight back.

At the dawn of the 20th century, Adolf Hitler, a struggling artist, has fought off dozens of assasination attemps by well meaning time travelers in his life. Approaching his late twenties, he manages to incapacitate the latest time traveller and hijacks his timecapsule.

Little Red Riding Hood gains access to the Multiversal Nexus and goes on to meet the Five Fundamental Wolves.

Laoh is a young noblewoman of a declining, once-powerful witch clan which once dominated the world, unwavering on her intent to restore her clan's name.

Aliens have come to conquer Earth and, after a brief confrontation with the combined armed forces of the planet, have established a protectorate over select major cities around the world, issuing an extermination edict for anything outside and carrying it out. Humans have conformed to this and other mandates, and apart from token resistance a relatively peaceful subservience has lasted for a few generations. Everything changes when encrypted messages embedded in Chinese food "fortune cookies" spread through the Protectorates calling volunteers to defend the human city of Defiance deep in the desert of the North American Extermination Zone.
A gang of dogs searches for the remnants of humanity in the Last City.
There are only two cities. One city builds instruments, not knowing how to use them, and another uses them, not knowing how they are made. They meet for the first time.

A rogue planet is on a full impact course with the world. Humanity has had years to preparare for the inevitable, having exhausted all available options. A few weeks before impact everything stops. A handful of seemingly random people are untouched by the event and cannot die, a message flashes briefly across their retinas in their native languages: "However long it takes, save us all!"

The U.N. is an aterritorial, untouchable megapower that imposes a hyper-militarist "Pax Universalis" on the Earth and its whereabouts. A bunch of well-organised, high-spirited and super-secret anarcho-libertarians epically fail at trying to set humanity free from its yoke.

The Emperor of Gummy Bears dies, and a war for the throne starts immediately after

Without an apparent reason, the isle of Pandaria declares war to both the Alliance and the Horde

A flourishing insular nation with urban people living well above their means finds out that the countryside is populated, and the hillibillies want to break away from the utopian society dreamed up by their war Prime Minister, and take back control of their borders and fisheries.

September 10, 2001. A commando of dark elves kills an important businessman during a party on a terrace in downtown NYC. The other elvish peoples end their self-exile and start siding either with humans or with dark elves in an unprecedented inter-racial war.

An interstellar conflict flares up when the Programmers discover that civilizations all over the universe have developped "magic" as a way to alter the universe's code from the inside, and decide to subtly foster frictions between civilizations instead of directly intervening themselves.
Gollum climbs out of Mt Doom's furnace in an impressive magi-tech exoskeleton, heavily burnt but resolved to effectively kick Frodo's (+Gandalf's!) ass.

Un aereo canaglia è in rotta di impatto completo con il mondo. L'Umanità Haft, una fazione terrestre, si prepara per due anni per l'inevitabile, dopo aver esaurito tutte le opzioni disponibili. Poche settimane prima dell'impatto il Tutto si ferma. Una manciata di persone apparentemente casuali sono incontaminate dal caso e non possono morire, un messaggio lampeggia brevemente attraverso la retina dei Deres, madri delle lingue: "tutto il tempo necessario, salvaci tutti!"
The mackerel one, you know the drill

Star Wars is true. A delegation from the Galactic Senate comes to Earth to make first contact with our newly discovered species, only for us to discover we know a lot more about their history than they do. During negotiations a United Nations Security Council member discovers that Palpatine is currently Senator and there is a trade dispute brewing over the Outer Rim planet of Naboo.

A contingent of rabbits is forced to leave its original warren after a human-caused catastrophe destroys it, and has to venture in the countryland in order to establish a new warren and live a new life, amidst new friend and many new foes.

The genius teen philosopher Cha Peong Pung discovers a way to access to alternative worlds, whose hierarchical order depends on their proximity to an ideal world created by God which is not the one he lives in.
A pizza-hungry indie videogame developer emerges from the basement where he's been holed up for ten years only to discover that humanity has moved on quite a bit and he's left the keys inside.
A gang of dogs searches for the remnants of humanity in the Last City.

An event causes the Earth to be stuck in a time loop. Several people around the world are aware of the loop and are desperately trying to end it, as others fight to keep the loop going for as long as possible.

Mankind, at the beginning of its colonization age in the Milky Way, is now organized in massive, corporation-like states who fight for the biggest influence in the system. As the massive, AI-based UN-like organization called ALEPH - hailed as mankind's greatest creation - comes in service, to oversee the Human Sphere, a new alien menace threatens humanity.

Very, very few superpowered individuals exist on Earth, hunted by powerful government agencies. Most of them are unaware of their own superpowers until a rogue government agent intentionally starts a chain of events that will bring many of them together to fight back.

The members of the first international expedition to Mars discover an old Soviet flag placed down decades ago. The Soviets had won the space race long before but decided to bury their success and the horrifying truths it revealed.
The superluminal medium that allowed the development and flourishing of an interdependent interstellar empire is collapsing and its constituents are unprepared for the consequences.
The superluminal medium that allowed the development and flourishing of an interdependent interstellar empire is collapsing and its constituents are unprepared for the consequences.
Current Phase

Vote anything.

old.name: Current Phase

card.name: Laoh is young noblewoman of a declining, once-powerful witch clan which once dominated the world, unwavering on her intent to restore her clan's name.

Aliens have come to conquer Earth and, after a brief confrontation with the combined armed forces of the planet, have established a protectorate over select major cities around the world, issuing an extermination edict for anything outside and carrying it out. Humans have conformed to this and other mandates, and apart from token resistance a relatively peaceful subservience has lasted for a few generations. Everything changes when encrypted messages embedded in Chinese food "fortune cookies" spread through the Protectorates calling volunteers to defend the human city of Defiance deep in the desert of the North American Extermination Zone.

A gang of dogs searches for the remnants of humanity in the Last City.
Humanity is subjugated by a swarm of piglet-shaped nanobots.
There are only two cities. One city builds instruments, not knowing how to use them, and another uses them, not knowing how they are made. They meet for the first time.

Un aereo canaglia è in rotta di impatto completo con il mondo. L'Umanità Haft, una fazione terrestre, si prepara per due anni per l'inevitabile, dopo aver esaurito tutte le opzioni disponibili. Poche settimane prima dell'impatto il Tutto si ferma. Una manciata di persone apparentemente casuali sono incontaminate dal caso e non possono morire, un messaggio lampeggia brevemente attraverso la retina dei Deres, madri delle lingue: "tutto il tempo necessario, salvaci tutti!"

A rogue planet is on a full impact course with the world. Humanity has had years to preparare for the inevitable, having exhausted all available options. A few weeks before impact everything stops. A handful of seemingly random people are untouched by the event and cannot die, a message flashes briefly across their retinas in their native languages: "However long it takes, save us all!"
A group of scientists manages to capture the life-force of dying organisms across the whole timeline and put it in a controlled plane of existence, retroactively creating the Afterlife.
Little Red Riding Hood gains access to the Multiversal Nexus and goes on to meet the Five Fundamental Wolves.
Without an apparent reason, the isle of Pandaria declares war to both the Alliance and the Horde

old.name: Without an apparent reason, the isle of Pandaria declares wars to both the Alliance and the Horde

card.name: Without an apparent reason, the isle of Pandaria declares wars to both the Alliance and the Horde

Star Wars is true. A delegation from the Galactic Senate comes to Earth to make first contact with our newly discovered species, only for us to discover we know a lot more about their history than they do. During negotiations a United Nations Security Council member discovers that Palpatine is currently Senator and there is a trade dispute brewing over the Outer Rim planet of Naboo.
Gangsters fight each other and the police to get a piece of the action in a big industrial city.
The Roman Empire has grown, suffered, shrunk and fought, but it has survived. It is now the year 2751AUC (Ab Urbe Condita).
All the inhabitants of a small village in Southern Italy are vested with god-tier superpowers.

On April 15th, 1912, the RMS Titanic is cursed by the Goddess of the Seas: the passenger and the crew become immortals, and are forced to navigate the oceans until the end of time. These are their stories.

The Emeritus Doctor Louisiana Jones, in the year 3692 A.I., reveals that the entrance to the long forgotten city of Atlantis is in Crete. This sparks endless controversy on the Internet, a number of old conspiracy theorists find new material in support of their ideas, and Atlantis makes an unlikely comeback from outer space. (an epistular story)

#Brexit (= se non si fosse capito a cosa si riferiva l'altra)
Gollum climbs out of Mt Doom's furnace in an impressive magi-tech exoskeleton, heavily burnt but resolved to effectively kick Frodo's (+Gandalf's!) ass.
A group of slaves rebel against a huge, oppressive, and crumbling Empire.

old.name: A group of slaves rebel against a huge, oppressive, and crumbling Empire

card.name: A group of slaves rebel against a huge, oppressive, and crumbling Empire

The U.N. is an aterritorial, untouchable megapower that imposes a hyper-militarist "Pax Universalis" on the Earth and its whereabouts. A bunch of well-organised, high-spirited and super-secret anarcho-libertarians epically fail at trying to set humanity free from its yoke.
In the energized gonzo world of Big Bone's wacky but ruthless start-up scene, a small inculator gestates a potentially multi-trillion loots company.

Very, very few superpowered individuals exist on Earth, hunted by powerful government agencies. Most of them are unaware of their own superpowers until a rogue government agent intentionally starts a chain of events that will bring many of them together to fight back.
The Princess of Bayreuth is married to the weak-willed King of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, and decides to take de facto control of the state and lead it to glory everlasting.
As the Divine Apocalypse scourges the Earth's surface, a bunch of tough guys seek for refuge in the underground. Where they meet the Others.
As the Divine Apocalypse scourges the Earth's surface, a bunch of tough guys seek for refuge in the underground. Where they meet the Others.
Federico "Ginger" O'Malley is elected as the first Irish Pope of the Roman Church. God Almighty goes nuts, takes action against a sea of troubles, and by opposing ends them.
The Emperor of Gummy Bears dies, and a war for the throne starts immediately after
A complicated friendship between a time traveller and an immortal.

Harry, Ron and Hermione aren't actually wizards or in the wizarding world. They are high on drugs and hallucinating throughout their journeys. The cops are Dementors and Dumbledore is a crazy old homeless man.

The members of the first international expedition to Mars discover an old Soviet flag placed down decades ago. The Soviets had won the space race long before but decided to bury their success and the horrifying truths it revealed.

At the dawn of the 20th century, Adolf Hitler, a struggling artist, has fought off dozens of assasination attemps by well meaning time travelers in his life. Approaching his late twenties, he manages to incapacitate the latest time traveller and hijacks his timecapsule.

California falls into the sea and generations later it rises again from the ocean.

As Krysa's conquering campaign comes to its inevitable end by subjugating the remnants of freedom in the world, one of her Archons defies her god-like immeasurable sorcery unbinding one of her Decrees.

The various factions of the solar system hover on the brink of war as they move closer to discovering the truth about a scientific conspiracy that will change everything and open the doors of an infinite universe.
A Dungeons & Dragons world is created.

An interstellar conflict flares up when the Programmers discover that civilizations all over the universe have developped "magic" as a way to alter the universe's code from the inside, and decide to subtly foster frictions between civilizations instead of directly intervening themselves.
